channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Rats in bins, 24th September
item.description:
Everytime I go to put my bin out there are rats above or under them. Yesterday there was a rat inside. First it was one now I’ve seen 3 at once. There is cardboard that has been there for months and boxes are dumped and not collected. I don’t want to touch anything as I’m afraid I will catch something. Please can this be resolved?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 18a Portland Street, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Water leak, 24th September
item.description:
There has been a steady stream of water coming from under the road which has now started to enter my driveway. If this isn't fixed soon this water will turn to ice in the coming months.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Postings Stockwell Lane, Cleeve Hill
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned B@Q shopping trolley, 22nd September
item.description:
Abandoned shopping trolley at this location, I have reported to a staff member at B@Q ,who replied “I doubt very much we will do anything about it” Not the reply I was expecting!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 1 Coberley Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Crashed car still blocking this busy crossing`, 22nd September
item.description:
The crashed car is still blocking this busy crossing. pedestrians and cyclists are having to negotiate the debris and damaged uneven ground to get though. It is very hazardous trying to control a bike on uneven ground at the edge of this busy and fast stretch of road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Princess Elizabeth Way, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cars parking on grass verge, 22nd September
item.description:
Cars are now parking on the grass verge on the inside of a bend making visibility of on coming traffic hard. The neighbourhood does have fines for parking on the grass around, but not specifically on this street.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 21 Dorset Avenue, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned home?, 22nd September
item.description:
This house has the curtains drawn all day, and a light on all day. The garden is massively overgrown and has rats. It is an eyesore for any neighbours
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 25a Dorset Avenue, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lot of broken glass on pavement by crossing, 22nd September
item.description:
Lots of broken glass right where people wait to cross the road. Dangerous because people are walking in the road to avoid it.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 9 Bath Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lots of broken glass across the width of the road and pavement, 22nd September
item.description:
Once again this road is covered in broken glass from smashed bottles and glasses. This is an ongoing problem and a real hazard for pedestrians, cyclists, dogs etc. Most days of the week it is like this.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Cambray Cottages Vernon Place, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Massively overgrown vegetation covering footpath, 21st September
item.description:
The pavement side towards Tewkesbury has been massively overgrown with vegetation for a long time, to the extent its almost impassable on foot and brings pedestrians dangerously close to vehicles on the road. It was implied that Bovis would have had to clear it as here is the supposed entrance point to their new Coombe Hill development, but as they've broken their planning consent and moved the vehicle entrance to the side on the A4019 (with no repercussions from Tewkesbury council), this pavement now really needs some upkeep for the safety of pedestrians.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 24 A38, Coombe Hill
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Golf Club Lane, Brockworth
